senses.sense_definition: A mollusk that has a shell consisting of a single piece, or the shell itself.

examples.text: The biology student examined the spiral structure of the <w>univalve</w> found on the beach.
A common <w>univalve</w> in the garden is the snail, which carries its home on its back.

senses.sense_definition: Having a shell that consists of a single piece or valve.

examples.text: Most land snails are <w>univalve</w> creatures that retreat into their shells for protection.
The collection included several <w>univalve</w> specimens from the coral reef.
